Definition at line 1094 of file Omisc.cpp.

References str_buf.

void Misc::cal_move_around_a_point (  short    num,
short    width,
short    height,
int &    xShift,
int &    yShift
) 
 

This function is used to return the x_Offset and y_Offset from the center of the square. The detail is shown in the following figure.

21 20 19 18 17 22 7 6 5 16 23 8 1 4 15 24 9 2 3 14 25 10 11 12 13

Assume the square is 5x5, 1 is the center of the square. The input value of num determine which point is processed. For instance, 9 is processed if num=9.

using the center as the reference point, (xShift, yShift) = (-1, -1) for num=7, (xShift, yShift) = (0,2) for num=11.

For num>25 in this case, multiply of 25 will be cut out until num<=25.

Definition at line 30 of file Omisc.cpp.

int Misc::diagonal_distance (  int    x1,
int    y1,
int    x2,
int    y2
) 
 

Given two lengths in x and y coordination, then find the diagonal distance between them result = the square root of X*X + Y*Y

<int> x1, y1 = the starting point of the diagonal line <int> x2, y2 = the ending point of the diagonal line

Definition at line 60 of file Omisc.h.

char * Misc::format (  int    inNum,
int    formatType = 1
) 
 

Format a number to a string with specified format Note : the formated string is right justified

int inNum = the number to be formated

[int] formatType = 1 - 1,000,000 add thousand seperator 2 - $1,000,000 add thousand seperator and dollar sign 3 - 56% add percentage sign % at the end of the number 4 - 1000000, no thousand seperator 5 - $1,000K, thousand seperator, no decimal place and dollar sign 7 - $1,000,000, for surplus display! Font diamond only! (default : 1) 8 - -10% '-' sign for negative value 9 - display the 1/1000 of the real value.(showing 0 dec place.) 10 - display the 1/100 of the real value. (showing 2 dec place.) 11 - display the 1/1000 of the real value.(showing 2 dec place.) 12 - display the 1/1000 of the real value.(showing 0 dec place.) with 'K' 13 - (1000) 14 - 100hrs 17 - 100hrs/week //## chea 180999 not use yet... 15 - display the 1/10 of the real value. (showing 1 dec place.) 16 - display in the format "Yr.2", "Yr.3" 28 - (1,000,000) // Kenneth 29 - (56%) //marco 30 - display the 1/1000 of the real value. (showing 1 dec place.) with 'K'

return <char*> the pointer to the converted string, the string is stored in static variable which will be overwritten in next call.

Definition at line 609 of file Omisc.cpp.

References sign().

char * Misc::format (  double    inNum,
int    formatType = 1
) 
 

Format a number to a float number to format string Note : the formated string is right justified

<double> inNum = the number to be formated use <double> instead of <float> because fcvt() only accept <double>

[int] formatType = 1 - 1,000,000 add thousand seperator 2 - $1,000,000 add thousand seperator and dollar sign 3 - 56% add percentage sign % at the end of the number (0 dec) 5 - $1,000K thousand seperator, no decimal place and dollar sign 7 - $1,000,000, for surplus display! Font diamond only! 8 - -56.2% show '-' for negative number, (1 DEC) 9 - show integer part only 13 - (1000.0) //marco 14 - 100hrs 15 - 100hrs/week 16 - 100hrs/week (with 1 dec) 23 - 23.32 (2 dec places. no %) 24 - 23.3% (1 dec places. & %) 25 - 23.32% (2 dec places with %) 26 - 23.3 (1 dec place) 27 - ($1,000,000) 28 - (1,000,000) 29 - (23%) 30 - 23.3K (1 dec place with K) return <char*> the pointer to the converted string, the string is stored in static variable which will be overwritten in next call.

char * Misc::nullify (  char *    strPtr,
int    strLen
) 
 

Nullify and right trim a string field in the record

<char*> strPtr = string pointer <int> strLen = string length

Return : <char*> the nullied string which only stored in static buffer temporary until next call to nullify()

note : if the string is longer than the buffer space, the string will be truncated

Definition at line 1023 of file Omisc.cpp.

int Misc::points_distance (  int    x1,
int    y1,
int    x2,
int    y2
) 
 

Given two lengths in x and y coordination, then find the distance between two points, taking diagonal distance the same as the horizontal and vertical distances.

<int> x1, y1 = the starting point of the diagonal line <int> x2, y2 = the ending point of the diagonal line

Definition at line 1606 of file Omisc.cpp.

References err_when.

float Misc::round (  float    inValue,
int    signPlace,
int    roundDirection = 0
) 
 

Round the float no. to the 2 signicant values :

Since this function is not called frequently, we can afford to use a slower algorithm.

<float> inValue = the number to be rounded. <int> signPlace = round to no. of signicant places. [int] roundDirection = 0-if <= 4, round to a smaller, if >=5 round to a bigger 1-round to a smaller number 2-round to a bigger number (default : 0)

return : <float> the rounded number
